XD0344-d-11-10-03-CRL.Narrative: CRL SWITCH 1600 IMX SWITCH CREW WAS PUTTING TOGETHER OURBOUND TRAIN USING TRACKS 1,2,3&4. THE CREW SHOVED TRACK # 1 EAST 3 CAR LENGTHS THEN COUPLED TO TRACK #2AND SHOVED EAST APPROXIMATELY 6 CAR LENGTHS TO A COUPLING THEN MOVED WEST ON E CAR AND THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. UPON INSPECTION IT WASDISCOVERED THAT WHEN #1 TRACK WAS SHOVED EAST, THE CARS SNAGGED A TRUCK TRAILER AND SHOVE INTO OTHERTRAILERS AND THEN IT TURNED SIDEWAYS FORCING TTZX 553576 & TTAX555159 OFF OF THE RAIL AND INTO THESIDE OF FEC7055. THE CAUSE OF THE INCIDENT WAS NOT DETERMINED, HOWEVER TRUCKS WERE MOVING ADJACENT TO TRACK#1.ONE OF THESE TRUCKS COULD HAVE MOVED THE TRAILER INTO THE SIDE OF #1 TRACK.THIS HAS HAPPENED BEFORE AT THIS FACILITY AND THE UP MANAGEMENT OS WORKING ON A PERMANENT SOLUTION. COSTS ARE TO BEINVOICED TO THE UNION PACIFIC.

XD0346-d-11-20-03-CRL.Narrative: THE 100 AM CANAL STREET CREW WAS SHOVING TRACK 605 NORTHWARD TO THE FENCE LEAD. CONDUCTOR DID NOT NOTICE THAT THE "BULL" CROSSOVER SWITCH WAS LINED TO 604 TRACK WHICH WAS PROTECTED BY A DERAIL AND MENWORKING SIGN. THE SWITCH CUT RAN OVER THE DERAIL AND COUPLED TO CARS IN 604 TRACK. THE MIDDLE TRUCKOF A THREE UNIT EMPTY SPINE CAR DERAILED. THE CREW WAS DRUG TESTED FOR PROBABLE CAUSE AND REMOVED FROM SERVICE PENDING FORMAL INVESTIGATION.

182246-d-11-05-03-SOO.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 06:55 TRAIN 298-01 WAS PROCEEDING OUT OF DRAKE AFTER PICKING UP 22 CARS. THE SECTION CALLED THEM TO INFORM THEM THAT IT APPEARED , ONE CAR TOWARDS THE REAR OF THE TRAIN WAS DERAILED.CREW WAS JUST STARTING OUT IN AN EASTWARDLY DIRECTION AND WAS ONLY TRAVELING 7 MPH ACCORDING TO DOWNLOAD. NO EXCEPTION TAKEN TO TRAIN HANDLING. CREW STATES NO INDICATION OF TROUBLE PRIOR TO THE NOTIFICATION BY THE SECTION CREW.   NO INJURIES/HAZ MAT INVOLVED. MT OPEN APP. 13:00.    CAUSE:  CRACKED WHEEL ON CAR SOO 64053 CAUSED CAR TO DERAIL AND WAS DRAGGED FROM MP 427 TO 420

182256-d-11-05-03-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Highway user cited for violation of highway-rail grade crossing traffic laws
182256-d-11-05-03-SOO.Accident Cause: Highway user cited for violation of highway-rail grade crossing traffic laws
182256-d-11-05-03-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 185 TRAVELING WEST ON NO. 1 MAIN APPROACHING SPRINGDALE DRIVE CROSSING.  AS TRAIN REACHED THEWHISTLE POST, CREW OBSERVED A TOW TRUCK TOWING GARBAGE TRUCK THAT WAS STOPPED ON THE CROSSING.  ENGINEER PLACED TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY AND STRUCK THE GARBAGE TRUCK ABOUT MID CAB WHICH SEPERATED UPON IMPACT INTO TWO PIECES.  THE DUMP BOX ENDED UP ON THE COMPASS SOUTH SIDE OF NO. 2 MAIN ABOUT 300 FEET FROM THE CROSSING.  CAB SECTION OF GARBAGE TRUCK WAS PUSCHED DOWN NO. 1 TRACK IN FRONT OF LEAD LOCOMOTIVE CP 9633 FOR ABOUT 1,000 FEET.  EXTENSIVE DAMAGE WAS INCURRED TO LEAD LOCOMOTIVE, SIGNALS AS WELL AS SOME TRACK DAMAGE. NORTHWEST SIDE OF CROSSING WAS DESTROYED BY IMPACT.  CROSSING PROTECTION CONSISTED OF GATES AND STANDARD FLASHERS.  GATES ON NORTH SIDE OF CROSSING WERE FULLY LOWERED PRIOR TOTRAIN'S ARRIVAL.  GATE ON SOUTH SIDE STRUCK GARBAGE TRUCK AND WAS NOT ABLE TO COME DOWN TO FULLY LOWERED POSITION. DRIVER OF TOW TRUCK APPARENTLY STOPPED ON CROSSING AFTER LIGHTS ON CROSSING BEGAN FLASHING.  DRIVER OF TOW TRUCK ATTEMPTED TO BACK OFF CROSSING BUT WAS UNABLE.  DRIVER OF TOW TRUCK WASISSUED CITATION FOR FAILURE TO ADHERE TO TRAFFIC/CROSSING SIGNALS.  IMPACT RESULTED IN THE FUEL TANKON THE GARBAGE TRUCK TO BE RUPTURED RESULTING IN THE SPILL OF APPROXIMATELY 100 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL BETWEEN THE CROSSING AND THE POINT WHERE TRAIN STOPPED.  INCIDENT WAS WITNESSED BY A POLICE OFFICER FROM THE CITY OF BROOKFIELD.  TEN MILE PER HOUR SLOW ORDER WAS IMPLEMENTED OVER AFFECTED AREAS.

182671-d-11-29-03-SOO.Narrative: CN/WC TRAIN A442-8128, 79 LOADS, 45 EMPTIES, 10,498 ETT PULLING INTO 7 LEAD TRACK, SCHILLER PARK, ILDERAILED 13 CARS.  EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO CARS AS WELL AS TRACK WHICH IS MAINTAINED BY BOTH THE CN/WCAND CP/SOO RAILROADS.  UPON INSPECTION IT WAS DETERMINED THAT DERAILMENT WAS CAUSED BY SPREAD RAIL DUE TO WORN RAIL, FRA CAUSE CODE T113, AS PER WC.  THE POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS ON CN/WC TRACK, COMINGOUT OF THE TURNOUT, RIGHT AT THE FOULING POINT ENTERING THE NORTH END OF NO. 7 LEAD AND IS MAINTAINED BY CN/WC RAILROAD.  INCIDENT CAUSED $48,732 DAMAGE TO APPROXIMATELY 700-800 HUNDRED FEET OF RAILTHAT IS MAINTAINED BY CP/SOO.  WC ADVISED THEY INCURRED $36,700 IN COSTS TO THEIR EQUIPMENT AND $475TO THEIR TRACK.  WC REPORTING NUMBER IS 205389.

182691-d-11-29-03-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN H-31 OPERATING OVER UPRR MANKATO SUB ON SINGLE MAIN APPROACHING YOSEMITE AVENUE CROSSING, SAVAGE, MN WHEN TRACTOR-TRAILER PULLED UP TO THE CROSSING AND STOPPED WITH TRAILER CENTERED ON RAILROADTRACKS.  CREW SOUNDED WHISTLE, RANG BELL WITH NO RESPONSE FROM VEHICLE DRIVER.  ENGINEER MADE EMERGENCY APPLICATION AND CREW LAID DOWN ON FLOOR OF LOCOMOTIVE.  TRAIN STRUCK THE LOADED TRAILER CONTAINING CALCIUM CARBONATE.  UPON IMPACT TRAILER WRAPPED AROUND FRONT OF LEAD UNIT CP 4614 WITH TRACTOR SWINGING ON EAST SIDE OF THE LOCOMOTIVE CAUSING RUPTURE TO  LOCOMOTIVE FUEL TANK RESULTING IN THE SPILL OF APPROXIMATELY 500 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL.  TRAIN PROCEED FOR APPROXIMATELY ONE-QUARTER MILE BEFORE COMING TO A STOP.   ALL APPROPRIATE ENTITIES WERE NOTIFIED AND EMERGENCY REPONDERS RESPONDED TOSCENE.  INJURIES SUSTAINED TO DRIVER OF VEHICLE.  NO INJURIES REPORTED BY CREW OF TRAIN.

031120-d-11-10-03-URR.Accident Cause: Cross level of track irregular (not at joints)
031120-d-11-10-03-URR.Narrative: CREW WAS HAULING 60 COAL NORTH ON THE NORTH BESSEMER BRANCH ON THE TURTLE CREEK VIADUCT WHEN THE 53RD, 54TH, AND 55TH CAR OF TRAIN DERAILED.  53RD CAR BLE 65732 CAME TO REST ON ITS SIDE ON TRACK BED,54TH CAR BLE 65863 CAME TO REST ON HILL SIDE AND 55TH CAR DERAILED NORTH TRUCK.  WHEN TRAIN DERAILEDAND CARS WENT INTO EMERGENCY, CONDUCTOR IN CABOOSE SLID OFF HIS SEAT, FELL TO FLOOR AND SUSTAINED AREPORTABLE INJURY.  ALL CREW MEMEBERS WERE COMPANY REASONABLE CAUSE DRUG TESTED.

03146-d-11-25-03-URR.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train make-up
03146-d-11-25-03-URR.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train make-up
03146-d-11-25-03-URR.Narrative: CREW WAS SHOVING 40 LOADS OF COILS SOUTH THROUGH THE "BR" INTERLOCKING ENROUTE TO MIFFLIN.  TOTAL LOCOMOTIVES IN CONSIST WAS 5MP 1500 LOCOMOTIVES (7500 HP).  ENGINEER NOTICED LOCOMOTIVES DERAILING ANDSTOPPED TRAIN.  ALL 5 LOCOMOTIVES WERE DERAILED.  TRAIN WAS UNDER ALLOTTED TONNAGE.  GRADE WAS 1.55.  NO DEFICIENCIES IN TRACK WERE NOTED.  IT WAS ALSO DETERMINED THAT TRAIN WAS HANDLED PROPERLY.  SIMULATION OF TRAIN MOVEMENT DETERMINED BUFF FORCES DID NOT EXCEED THE THRESHOLD FOR BUFF FORCES TO BESOLE CAUSE OF DERAILMENT.  HOWEVER, IT WAS DETERMINED TO BE A BUFF FORCE DERAILMENT, HP OF LOCOMOTIVES, TONNAGE OF TRAIN AND RULING GRADE, NO EMPLOYEE WAS DETERMINED TO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE TRAIN ACCIDENT DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE RAILROADS BUSINESS AND OPERATING PROCEDURES.

ID03556-d-11-17-03-SJVR.Primary Accident Cause: Switch damaged or out of adjustment
ID03556-d-11-17-03-SJVR.Accident Cause: Switch damaged or out of adjustment
ID03556-d-11-17-03-SJVR.Narrative: BNSF EMPLOYEE REPORTED ON FRIDAY 11-14-03 TO BNSF YARDMASTER THAT THE 412 SWITCH HAD BEEN RAN THRU AND POINTS WERE GAPPED.  BNSF MANAGEMENT REFUSED TO TAKE ACTION AND DID NOT TAG, SECURE OR REPAIR SWITCH.  SJVR CREW ON MONDAY 11-17-03 WAS DELIVERING 40 CARS IN INTERCHANGE TO BNSF TRACK 421.  17 CARSOF THE 40 CAR COUNT MADE IT OVER THE 412 SWITCH.  THE 18TH CAR TRAILING TRUCKS BEGAN DERAILING AT THE 412 LEAD SWITCH, RESULTING IN 2 CARS BEING DERAILED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE 40 CAR CUT.

030411-d-11-04-03-NYA.Narrative: THE RS 50 HAD 33 CARS AND 2 ENGINES IN ROUTE TO SOUTHERN CONTAINER TO PICK UP 7 EMPTIES AND TO DELIVER 5 LOADS. UPON ARRIVAL AT DEER PARK THE RS-50 CUT AWAY 2 ENGINES ON THE EAST END AND PREPARED TO ENTER SOUTHERN CONTAINER WITH THE ENGINES TO COUPLE TO 7 EMPTY CARS AND TO ADD 7 EMPTIES TO THE EASTEND OF THEIR CONSIST. THE RS-50 CREW THEN MOVED THE ENTIRE 40 CAR CONSIST FROM THE MAIN TRACK AND THEN SHOVED WEST INTO SOUTHERN CONTAINER SIDING, WHEN THE ENGINEER STOPPED THE TRAIN, THE 18TH CAR JUMPED THE TRACK. WHEN THE ENGINEER BEGAN HIS WEST SHOVE IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION CAUSING THE 17TH CARTO DERAIL.

PB110703-d-11-07-03-NOPB.Narrative: JOB 206 WAS MAKING A SWITCH MOVE IN CWY 18.  JOB 201 COUPLED UP TO CUT IN CWY 22 AND WERE WAITING INTHE CLEAR UNTIL JOB 206 CROSSED OVER FROM SWITCHING LEAD TO INTERCHANGE LEAD TO BRING CUT OUT OF CWY 18 OVER TO SWITCHING LEAD.  FOREMAN JOB 201 ASKED FOREMAN JOB 206 WHO STANDING AT CROSSOVER SWITCHABOUT A FEW CAR LENGTHS AWAY FROM HIM IF HE LINED UP MOVE JOB 201.  THE TWO FOREMAN CONVERSED BY MOUTH AND NOT AS REQUIRED VIA COMPANY PHONE.  FOREMAN 201 MISUNDERSTOOD FOREMAN JOB 206 ANSWER AND THINKING THE ROUTE WAS LINED CORRECTLY PROCEED TO SHOVE JOB 201 THROUGH THE CROSSOVER AND INTO JOB 206CUT.

2003112302-d-11-23-03-MNCW.Narrative: BETWEEN CATENARY 347 AND CATENARY 348 ON TRACK 1, THERE IS AN AREA WHERE THE END OF A WIRE RUN GOESTO THE TERMINATION WIRE, WHICH IS SUPPORTED BY THE WEIGHTS.  THE WIDTH BETWEEN THE WIRE GOING OUT OFRUNNING AND THE RUNNING WIRE IS TOO WIDE, EITHER BY ERROR IN DESIGN OR INSTALLATION. 2003269-d-11-01-03-ICE.Narrative: TRAIN WAS COMING INTO THE YARD WHEN IT WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  UPON INSPECTING THE TRAIN, IT WAS FOUNDTHAT 6 CARS HAD DERAILED.  AFTER INSPECTING THE CARS AND THE RAIL INVOLVED IN THIS DERAILMENT, IT WAS FOUND THAT THE RAIL HEAD BEING WORN TO THE SAME PROFILE AS THE WHEELS CAUSED MORE THAN NORMAL CONTACT BETWEEN THE WHEEL FLANGE, TREAD, AND RAIL CREATING AN OPPORTUNITY FOR A SLACK RUN IN TO CAUSE THE WHEEL TO CLIMB THE RAIL.  WHEN THE SLACK RAN IN, THE WHEEL DID CLIMB OVER THE RAIL - A CASE OF LATERAL FORCES EXCEEDING VERTICAL FORCES.

2003300-d-11-29-03-ICE.Narrative: MKCSP WAS TRAVELING NORTH AND THE 15TH THROUGH 25TH CAR DERAILED. CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT IS DUE TOIMPROPER HANDLING OF AUTOMATIC AND DYNAMIC BRAKES WHILE TRAVELING ON A .75 DESCENDING GRADE.  THE ENGINEER RELEASED THE AIR AND AT THE SAME TIME RAPIDLY REDUCED THE THROTTLE FROM 8 NOTCH TO IDLE, THEN TRANSITIONING INTO DYNAMIC BRAKE.  THIS CAUSED THE 86 CAR TRAIN TO GO FROM A SLACK STRETCHED CONDITION TO A SLACK BUNCHED CONDITION CREATING EXCESSIVE IN-TRAIN BUFF FORCES, WHICH DEVELOPED ENOUGH FORCE TO CAUSE THE 15TH CAR FROM THE HEAD END TO CLIMB THE HIGH SIDE OF A 3 DEGREE 10 MINUTE CURVE.

THE CARS THAT DERAILEDWERE AT OR PAST THE SWITCH GOING INTO 6204 WHEN THEY STOPPED AND REPORTED CARS ON THE TRACK TO THEYARDMASTER AND ASKED HIM TO PROTECT THE REAR OF THE TRAIN AS THEY BACKED UP.  THE TRAILING WHEELS OFTHE LEAD TRUCK (DURING THE REVERSE MOVEMENT) ON BNSF 473001 HAD A LARGE AMOUNT OF HEAD FLOW, AND ATWO INCH SECTION OF THE HEAD FLOW WAS CHIPPED OUT OF THE WHEEL ON THE FROG SIDE OF THE TRUCK.  THE TWO INCH SECTION OF CHIPPED OUT HEAD FLOW WAS FOUND IN THE FLANGEWAY OF THE FROG WHERE THE DERAILMENTOCCURRED.  THIS SECTION OF THE WHEEL HAD TO HAVE CHIPPED OUT DURING THE REVERSE MOVEMENT, SINCE THIS WHEEL WAS ABOUT THREE TO FOUR FEET SOUTH OF THE FROG DURING THE FORWARD MOVEMENT.  WE BELIEVE IRREGULAR HEAD FLOW OF THE WHEEL WAS THE PRIMARY CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT.  A DETAILED INVESTIGATION INDICATED THAT A WHEEL CLIMBED THE FROG OF THE YARD LEAD EAST TO THE VALLEY YARD FROG JUST AFTER IT PASSED THE POINT OF FROG.
